Title: How do you prove that $n^n$ is $O(n!^2)$?
Content:
It seems obvious that:
$$n^n \in O(n!^2)$$
But I can't seem to find a good way to prove it.
AcceptedAnswer:
Use a multiplicative variant of Gauss's trick :
$$
(n!)^2 = (1 \cdot n) (2 \cdot (n-1)) (3 \cdot (n-2)) \cdots
                ((n-2) \cdot 3) ((n-1) \cdot 2) (n \cdot 1)
                \ge n^n
$$
llm_answer_create_structured_problem:
###BEGIN_OF_FORMAT###
Assumption: 
$n$ is a positive integer.
Problem: 
Prove that $$n^n \in O(n!^2)$$.
###END_OF_FORMAT###
